speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when your symptoms started, did it begin suddenly or gradually over time?

speaker: Patient
text: Well, to be honest, doc, I think it started a few weeks ago, maybe around 4 weeks ago. It was a bit of a gradual thing, where I just felt really tired all the time, and then over the past couple of weeks, my abdominal pain has been getting worse, and I've been losing weight, too.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when your symptoms started, did it begin suddenly or gradually over time?

speaker: Patient
text: It was like my body just wasn't functioning the way it used to, you know? I'd get tired after doing simple tasks, like taking a shower or getting dressed. And the abdominal pain, at first, it was just a dull ache, but now it's getting sharper and more painful, especially at night.

speaker: Doctor
text: So the symptoms started gradually over time. Can you tell me more about the abdominal pain? Is it constant or does it come and go, and is it more painful when you move around or after eating?

speaker: Patient
text: Honestly, doc, it seems to be worse at night, especially when I'm lying down. And the pain seems to be more constant now, but I'd say it's more of a dull ache during the day. It gets sharper and more unbearable when I lie down, and I wake up multiple times throughout the night because of it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the nature of the fatigue? Is it more of a general feeling of tiredness, or is it a sharp, stabbing sensation that makes it hard for you to carry out daily activities?

speaker: Patient
text: It's more of a general feeling of tiredness, doc. I just feel like I'm running on empty, you know? I can manage to get through my day, but I'm always looking forward to going home and resting, and even that can be a chore sometimes.

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about the nature of the fatigue? Is it more of a general feeling of tiredness, or is it a sharp, stabbing sensation that makes it hard for you to carry out daily activities?


Doctor: 
Also, have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, chills, or difficulty swallowing?

speaker: Patient
text: No fever, doc, and I don't think I've had any chills. As for difficulty swallowing, I don't really think so, but I have been having trouble wearing my usual clothes because of the swelling I mentioned earlier, which has been developing over the past few days.
